dmca.title: [ADMINS] Formal notice of offending material under DMCA -http://www.oldta scosacyclin
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Carter 
Sent: Thursday, December 07, 2006 11:03 AM
To: Legal
Subject: FW: [ADMINS] Formal notice of offending material under DMCA
-http://www.oldta
scosacycling.com/files/willorado/natwest/Login.html(70.86.191.90)
Importance: High

-----Original Message-----
From: ~ GS&F, Information Security - I&TM [threatmanagement@rbs.co.uk]
Sent: Thursday, December 07, 2006 8:57 AM
To: abuse; Admins; abuse@123-reg.co.uk; services@123-reg.co.uk
Subject: [ADMINS] Formal notice of offending material under DMCA
-http://www.oldta
scosacycling.com/files/willorado/natwest/Login.html(70.86.191.90)
Importance: High


Sirs,

I am afraid to inform you that a server registered by yourselves
www.nationwide-house.co.uk/site <www.nationwide-house.co.uk/site>
(70.86.191.90) is being used to host unauthorised material the
intellectual property of Coutts Bank and The Royal Bank of Scotland, a
fully owned subsidiary of Royal Bank of Scotland Group, contrary to
Chapter 5 of title 17, United States Code, Section 512(c), the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act.  

This material consists of the protected logos, design and brand of
Coutts Bank and Royal bank of Scotland in our online banking service, as
can be seen at www.coutts-online-banking.co.uk
<www.coutts-online-banking.co.uk> .
This fake banking site is aimed at fraudulently obtaining user names and
passwords of our customers and is breaking international trademark law
by utilising the Coutts brand without permission.

According to whois you are the ISP or registrar for this web site, if
this information is incorrect please let us know.
We need you to put this domain in hold so it is not available to
internet users and no one else can register it to a different IP
address.

1.   The offending material can be found at
www.nationwide-house.co.uk/site <www.nationwide-house.co.uk/site> 

2.   As well as breach of the DMCA, this hosting is contrary to 123-reg
terms of Service found at
http://www.123-reg.co.uk/terms/aup.shtml
<http://www.123-reg.co.uk/terms/aup.shtml>
 Acceptable User Policy 

3. We request that you respond expeditiously to remove, or disable
access to, the infringing material.

4.  Contact with Royal Bank of Scotland Group should be made through the
Duty Technician, currently Harj Bhakar, available on +44 7766 785541 or
on harj.bhakar@rbs.co.uk.

5.  On information and belief, no officer or agent of Royal Bank of
Scotland Group has authorised the use of our material in the manner, and
it is not protected use under US or English law.

6. The information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty
of perjury, I declare that the I am authorized to act on behalf of the
owner of an exclusive right that is being infringed.

We therefore request that you investigate this as a matter of urgency
and block access with immediate effect.  Additionally, to protect our
customers from further fraud, we request that you provide any details of
credentials, or the phishing kit, that have been logged to this site.

If you require any further information do not hesitate to contact us.


__________________________________________

        Harj S Bhakar, EnCE
        Royal Bank Of Scotland Group PLC
        Group Security & Fraud - Information Security
        Investigation & Threat Management

        Tel     : + 44 (0)207 615 6568  Ext: x336568         
        Mob   : + 44 (0)7766 785541
        Fax    : + 44 (0)131 523 9493
        Email : Harj.Bhakar@rbs.co.uk         

___________________________________________





The Royal Bank of Scotland plc, Registered in Scotland No. 90312.
Registered Office: 36 St Andrew Square, Edinburgh EH2 2YB

Authorised and regulated by the Financial Services Authority.

This e-mail message is confidential and for use by the addressee only.
If the message is received by anyone other than the addressee, please
return the message to the sender by replying to it and then delete the
message from your computer. Internet e-mails are not necessarily secure.
The Royal Bank of Scotland plc does not accept responsibility for
changes made to this message after it was sent.

Whilst all reasonable care has been taken to avoid the transmission of
viruses, it is the responsibility of the recipient to ensure that the
onward transmission, opening or use of this message and any attachments
will not adversely affect its systems or data. No responsibility is
accepted by The Royal Bank of Scotland plc in this regard and the
recipient should carry out such virus and other checks as it considers
appropriate
dmca.principal_name: Royal Bank Of Scotland Group PLC
